intro: Randia murina, commonly known as the small randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, spherical berries that are typically red when mature. Randia murina is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
